channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15334] Add avro support for spark hbase connector
item.description:
Avro is a popular format for hbase storage. User may want the support natively in the connector.

With the support, user can save serialized avro into hbase table, and then query on top of it using spark sql. The conversion between avro and catalyst datatype will be handled automatically. This is one way of support complex data types. Otherwise, user has to define their own customized Serdes to support complex data types.
item.summary: Add avro support for spark hbase connector

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Zhan:
Mind uploading the patch to reviewboard ?

This would make reviewing easier.
This patch is for pre-view, and it depends on HBAE-14801 and HBASE-15336.

Ted Yu Thanks for the quick response. I am trying to upload the patch to review board, but because it relies on the other patch (HBASE-14801 and HBASE-15336), the review cannot parse the diff. After the other two is ready, I will rebase the patch and upload it.

+    val unioned = keySeq ++ valueSeq

Naming unioned as unionedRow would make the code more readable.

For SchemaConverters.scala, please add some scaladoc explaining what conversion utils are provided.


+      case STRING => SchemaType(StringType, nullable = false)

Why is STRING not nullable ?

Ted Yu attach the diff to review board. Regarding the nullable, which is default in spark-avro package. The converter code is mainly from spark-avro package with minor change (added the doc with high level API). If possible, I would like keep the change as small as possible.

+1 overall

Jonathan Hsieh Theodore michael Malaska :
If you don't have further comment(s), I plan to integrate this tomorrow.
I am sure we will have Documentation update after these JIRAs, But can we have more details in the Description field for this one? Use cases, usage, benefit etc?
I created a documentation jira HBASE-15473, and add the description field.
Thanks for the patch, Zhan.
Thanks Ted Yu for the review.
